comments:
To repro:
1.  Create new WSDL file (accepting all defaults)
2.  Open WSDL file in source and remove the very first line (which should be
"<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>")
3.  Close WSDL file
4.  Double click WSDL file to re-open it

Results:
Unable to create this part due to an internal error. Reason for the failure:
null argument; (see full stack trace below)

NOTE:  even if I open the file in a text editor and correct it, I am still not
able to open it in the WSDL editor until I restart Eclipse

Expect:  at least a nicer error message

Oh, I'm using the N20050620 build

Well, something must have changed recently because it no longer fails in the
7/13 I-build; the problem had been that WSDLEditor was creating a
StructuredSelection with a null Definition - looks like Definition generation is
now robust in the face of a missing XML declaration.

This particular bug appears to have been fixed as it is no longer happening in
RC1.  However, I get the same error when I open a zero length WSDL file. 
However, since that issue is being tracked in 99267, I'll go ahead and mark this
on as verified since this particular issue is no longer occurring.
